Reviews.Title: “city hotel for shopping and sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: CarstenWatsons
Reviews.Content: First impresssion, two towers and a loud Sheikh Zayed Road in front. The Receptionist was friendly and helpful, so we could move in the room two hrs earlier than 3.p.m. . The deluxe Room was spacious, friendly and very clean. A big kitchen and huge frigde! Ok..just a pair of cuttlery and plates ... ;-) Bathroom..ok, clean functional and big! Ohh yes, many give guest give this report with the towels. i fully agree. First day many towels..big, medium and small. After three days..only two big towels :-(. Ok, i didn't agree with the bad reports about the lifts, it seems the hotel worked on this problem with a new electronic. Ok. for travellers/shopaholics. Dubai mall is not far...but don't walk! The streets behind hotel are still under construction, so it be a bit dangerous to walk on the construction side.Better take the Metro and then Bus in front of station to the Mall. Ok, result of the hotel? Again? Yes! if you don't need beach holiday and want a priceworthy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I really don't like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: epok100
Reviews.Content: I don't usually review motels because they rarely fall outside what one would expect. Frankly if this hotel had been as satisfactory as a roadside Best Western in the US, I would not have reviewed it either. There is something deeply unpleasant about this place. It's right on a hugely busy super highway (sheik Zayed Road) that produces an infernal roar 24 hours a day. The soundproofing is poor so you hear it everywhere you go from the rooftop to the bedroom to the lobby. It's like Chinese water torture. The room was large, clean and new, but kind of uncomfortable, everything is badly designed, drawers too low, closets that hit doors, a bathroom with no where to put anything. Also, no light switches near the bed so you have to get up after reading. I don't think I've seen that mistake in any hotel I've stayed in! The Suite also has a large section devoted to a kitchen. Why I don;t know. It even has a dishwasher and clothes machine...odd, I must be missing a point here. The windows were super filthy, barely able to see out of them onto a view, which in any case was very ugly. And the elevators are clearly a mistake. The architect of the building deserves to be banned from the UAE. He put 5 lifts into a 47 story building. Schindler has retrofitted them with a system that makes them as efficient as possible, but they are still inadequate. In fact I wonder if this was ever designed as a hotel from the start. The lobby is kind of scrunched. On the plus side it was clean, the towels were big.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option for whoever needs to be close to the exhibition center”
Reviews.Author: Andrea D
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, modern and spacios rooms. The hotel was fully booked so it was a very good opportunity to test their services. The elevators are few, but they are efficiently organized. If I had to indicate a weak point, may be it would be that there would be more people at the reception, particularly when the hotel is fully booked. The price is very adequate considering the service offered. Recommended for visitors and exhibitors at the exhibition center. It is 15/20' walking distance from the exhibition center (not so easy to walk), and 5 min in taxi. They always have taxis at the door.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible reception service spoiled all the impression”
Reviews.Author: Lenaschum
Reviews.Content: I really like the location and room size. Unfortunately my stay was spoiled by unprofessional reception personnel who did not informed me about all the conditions of wi-fi usage which caused additional costs for me. Moreover hotel does not have quality control system. For them staff is always right, not client, even when they can not prove it.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star!?”
Reviews.Author: DERSOY
Reviews.Content: What did you like about Emirates Grand Hotel? If this is the question than answer is very clear; 'Nothing!' Poor staff, poor hotel, high prices for a 2 stars hotel (they're saying that they have 4!?). If you want to spend your money for nothing, this hotel is the best solution. Staff is not helpful, rooms are not clean, operation seems like that they don't know what are they doing? I booked the hotel from here. I checked in the hotel in the afternoon and after I saw my room and hotel, I canceled my booking and moved to another hotel after 15min!. They charged me for 1 night after I canceled my booking but what to do, I prefer to pay extra rather than to stay on this hotel. As a professional hospitality member, my suggestion is to go and find another hotel unless if you want to spend your holiday or business time with a terrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elevator's System is total nightmare”
Reviews.Author: BellaAl
Reviews.Content: Went there with my cousin in Feb 2012. The location is great. We chose it, because it is close to Dubai Mall. The trip to the mall is easy, taxi ride 10-15 dirhams. Do not go by metro - too long, the price will be the same. The breakfast is decent, however the service in the restaurant is slow and a little disorganized during rush hour which is around 8.00 -10.00.You will wait for your cup of tea for 20 min. But if you do not want tea it is faster of course :))) Now the elevator system, well, whoever thought it would work has unlimited time resources, the elevators are complete nightmare. We lived on floor 8 and i was thanking God we are not any higher in this building, though the street noise is pretty bad (our room was on the road side). No chance to CATCH the elevator during breakfast time. There is a long line on floor 43, where the restaurant is. People become hostages of the floor they are in. Of course, you CAN walk down from floor 43, but will not the rest of the day be FREE? Because you will be wasted. The line of people is accumulated on the Ground floor to get to their floors, but no lift comes for a looooong time. Please do not forget anything, so you will have to come back, it took me 20 min to make a trip up and down to get my cell. 18 minutes of THIS TIME i was waiting for the elevator. The swimming pool is on floor 47, it is ok size, there is a jacuzzi, but somehow the swimming pool is in the shade most part of the day. Jacuzzi is good Check out was comparatively easy, but verryyy slow. Clerks are not helpful and really take their time to handle your request. I honestly do not recommend this hotel, next time i will go to the hotel i stayed last time, it was much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay BUT could have been better”
Reviews.Author: sfy186338
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very clean overall. Ideal location however a couple of things let the whole process down. The lifts are a complete nightmare. U seem to wait a lifetime for them to arrive and the gucci system is not soo easy after the annoyance of twidling thumbs whilst the lifts have a frenzy of non activity. The room a 1 bedroom appartment itself was very spacious, little things like a broken sink tap that nearly flooded the kitchen let the service down. TV channels are really poor of which only 20 channels worked majority in arabic. The washer stunk like a dead rat! The living room coffee table had seen better days, little things aside, it was a good place, it was cleaned daily and was situated in an ideal location close to the metro only if the hotel had completed a comprehensive checklist of the room and put little but really annoying things right. There was one big downside we checked in at gone midnite and couldnt help but notice the vast number of call girls that entered the hotel. There are a number of supermarkets close by to stock up on your groceries.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: garco1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for us(young couple), its 100m from the metro, one stop from Dubai mall and burj khalifa, couple of stops to mall of the emirates also connects you to older parts to of the city and the airport(about 35 mins).. the room was lovely and clean, can see where the complaints for the lifts come from but we didn't find them as bad as people made them out to be although it is a stupid system.. the concierge are excellent, very helpful with anything we needed including places to go out at night!!! hotel runs a bus every mornin to the beach and will bring you back...

Reviews.Title: “A good tour to Dubai and a grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kapoor S
Reviews.Content: When I first walked into Emirates Grand it was just like OH MY GOD can there be anything better than this. With amazing staff & a beautiful building, emirates grand is one of the best places to stay in Dubai where you have value for your money. The deluxe room was so good with a small table at the side & a beautiful bed. The room costs around 1000 dirham’s. The view we got from our room was that of the city so it was exciting to see the busy mode of life in Dubai. It is advisable to book a Dubai tour package as travel companies give u a a comprehensive service including sightseeing,dhowcruise,hotel stay,airport transfers at a lower cost.We booked from Antilog Vacations , an Indian company , as they are famous for arranging Dubai hotels.Their rates were cheaper than other companies as well.Services were better too. The other wonderful aspect about Dubai is that they have lovely beaches like the Jumeriah Beach & the Palm Beach. Did u know that Jumeriah means beautiful so this beach is termed as beautiful beach. Jumeriah beach is the most popular beach & has lovely white sands. Most of the tourists from western countries like America love this beach as in America most of the beaches have black sand which is quite sick for swimming & just having fun on the beach. From the beach you can get a view of Dubai amazing 7 star hotels Burj Al Arab which is also one of the tallest buildings in Dubai. There are also many hotels & private clubs on the beach where you can relax & have fun. Palm Beach is the beach which is at Palm Island hence very close to everything anyone can wish for an ideal place for shopping & water sports. Emirates grand is a property which is good for everything.Each & every aspect.Book it without thinking much

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice location and good service”
Reviews.Author: Siddiqullah16
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean room and friendly staff. I originally booked double room but when I arrived there were non available and then I was upgraded to suite. You get a nice view from the swimming pool which is on the top of the building. Good Management and only minutes away from metro tube

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diana8207
Reviews.Content: Close to burj kalifa and dubai mall, rooms size is ok, the elevators are very slow and it's difficult to get one on breakfast time.

Reviews.Title: “Location and value were the reasons to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Ciskey
Reviews.Content: The reason to stay at this hotel was because of it's walking distance to the Dubai Mall/Burj Khalifa during NYE. We are a family of 4 and stayed for 3 nights from December 30th. Check in was fast. Many people were sitting in the lobby and I was afraid our room wouldn't be ready yet but this was not the case. The 2 BR apartment was comfortable, not luxurious by any means but clean enough. We were satisfied for the price we paid. It was about 150 euro's including breakfast through Southtravels. We only ate breakfast at the first morning because it was quite a challenge to take the elevators to the upper floors (43rd it was if I'm correct). It took a long time to go up and down again after breakfast. Breakfast was a complete chaos, the floor was sticky because of the juice spoiled, although they were cleaning this immediately, many tables weren't cleaned and the food wasn't that nice. I guess it will be better on any other day but not during the high season. The restaurant was really understaffed. We waited for 30 minutes to get some coffee. It was better if they just made a self service for this. On NYE it was an easy walk to the Burj Khalifa, about 15-20 minutes and completely safe to walk because of the traffic lights. Will we stay again? Probably not, next time I make sure to book in time for NYE so the hotelprices aren't OTT in Dubai downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: aizdeen
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my family for 5 nights, the location is ideal on sheikh Zayed Road , very close to the Finance metro station , in walking distance to Dubai center mall & Burj Khalifa ,Rooms are great and the breakfast was perfect , friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “No problems with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bilje29
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for two nights in the beginning of December 2011 prior to starting a cruise. As we were arriving from the UK at 2am I emailed the hotel advising them of this and got a very swift polite reply. We actually arrived at 3am and were booked in promptly even though a large group has arrived just before us. Our travel agent had booked the room for us, requesting a twin, when we arrived we were asked if we wanted a kingsize we said yes and actually received and upgrade to an apartment/suite. Very large bedroom with ensuite bath room the bed was very comfortable and huge. The bathroom was fine but nothing exceptional. Fully fitted kitchen, lounge dining room, very clean and comfortable. We were on the front of the hotel 29th floor with views across the city and over the sea. We weren't booked for breakfast so can't comment on the dining room. We were there two full days and had no problem accessing a lift at any time, when out for the day the room was always cleaned when we returned incuding washing our coffee cups! It was only 150 meters to the monorail, we bought day tickets at a very reasonable cost, the system is very easy to use and we zipped about both to the old town and the Burg Kalipha to see the fountains, you get a shuttle bus from the Mono rail station direct to the mall. The hotel is in the business area but there are eateries close by. There is a Waitrose in the Dubai Mall where you can buy anything you might need we bought breakfast pastries yum. We had no problems with the hotel or staff (no I don't like the deposit system either) it's not a hotel to stay in for an extended holiday but fine for business or a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Emirates NOT So Grand”
Reviews.Author: kmonimac
Reviews.Content: Prior to reaching the Emirates Grand Hotel in Dubai, my companion was worried about our reservation as it was booked online and consulted with the hotel to confirm the reservation. The staff could not locate the reservation and requested he call back to allow the system time to update. Calling back as requested the following morning, the staff was rude and unpleasant and the call ended with the same instructions as the initial call. Because the funds were deducted we continued with our travels to reach the hotel. Upon arriving to and entering the 2 bedroom suite, the space was smaller than pictured and the furniture was worn. Overall, the hotel was clean (there were some stains on the carpeted floor) and centrally located – it is approximately a 10 minute drive from The Mall of Dubai and a five minute walk from the train station. Also, numerous restaurants are scattered throughout the area. Obtaining assistance from the staff was a crap shoot: service was either excellent or exceptionally poor and unaccommodating. The bathrooms were standard and did not have a bidet, but served their purpose. The suite had a washer that also doubled as a dryer, but the trick was to figure out how to adjust the setting from washing to drying. Upon consulting with the hotel staff, the same load ended up being washed 3 times and still no luck drying. We ended up searching for the unit model and instructions online to convert the washer to a dryer. In the end, we had to remove half of the newly washed, wet clothes to allow the dryer to thoroughly dry the other portion. The hotel charged per device for the internet, not per room. Additionally, the WI-FI service was poor as it was only available in one area in the suite. We had a LAN cable, but it was inoperable and we ended up utilizing the cord for the phone. However, once you get online, the internet is sufficient. The elevators were a bit of a hassle. There was one set on five chutes present, but only 4 worked (one was under construction) and waiting usually was a timely process. There were 2 bedrooms, but only one room had a television, phone, and a clock. The other room essentially only had a bed and counter and the extra blanket located in the closet was unclean as upon retrieving it for use, it was sprinkled with hairs. As this hotel is listed as a four-star and we reserved one of the better rooms, we were thinking breakfast was included, but upon inquiring, we were told it was not. The first morning, we ordered room service and the pancakes arrived cold and no milk was included with the muesli. There were a few blueberries and a strawberry on the plate, but not a part of the fruit plate. We requested a bowl of fruit to include blueberries and strawberries and were told those fruits were not permitted to be served as they were only utilized for garnish purposes. As soon as breakfast arrived, the housekeeping staff followed wanting to clean the room, however we requested they come back at a later time. On one occasion, we left the room relatively early and turned on the “service room” light, but once we returned in the evening, the room had not been serviced and would not be serviced until the next morning as the housekeeping staff completes their duties by 6pm daily. Taken as a whole, I will not stay here again when visiting Dubai. This hotel is marketed exceptionally well, but fails to deliver.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Anirudh48
Reviews.Content: Perfect location just outside the Finance metro station and located on the main Shekh Zayed road. Rooms are great and the breakfast was great. Amazing view from the breakfast room overlooking the Palm.

Reviews.Title: “Smal step for a tourist,a huge step for tourism”
Reviews.Author: Naderkobaissy
Reviews.Content: Wow, I was there,I rate this hotel a 5 stars hotel( not ranked )big room,actually a Studio ,got every thing,as i have been to many hotels worled wide ,this one is very nice ,near smal shops to get somthing to eat at night,also you can get a local sim card to call home,breakfast is even better than the well known Moevenpick breakfast,friendly staff at the resturant,porter recommend to get there soon,visa is arranged by the hotel,very good only three days. The reservation Lady made my short visit wonderful as of her organisation .thank you Very bad elevator system ,you have to wait for a long time to go up or down,at the check in,the staff is friendly , but the hotel shoul reject this deposit cash idea,it is not welcome by most of the guests. Over all, I recommend it to all of you either solo or with your family alike.

Reviews.Title: “2* Service - 5* Price”
Reviews.Author: JavedAhmed
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Dubai after staying one night in this hotel. And I am glad that I was there for one night only. I reached hotel at 2:30 p.m. and was told that room is not ready. Despite asking repeatidly, the reception staff was not willing to commit a time. They eventually gave me a room after 1.5 hour. When I reached the room, it did not open with the key provided and I had to waste another 15 minutes to get the key. It took so long because lifts took ages to come to you. This is a 40+ story building with 5 lifts. However, these seem to be grossly insufficient. I went out for an hour and came back. My room wouldn't open once again. I asked the house keeping guy, who was around, to open the room. He was kind enough to try. However, the room did not open even with the master key that he had. He said the room is double locked and only Reception can resolve this matter. So, I was back to Reception and it took me no less than 1 hour coupled with a lot of shouting after which their manager came up with a key that opened the lock. To make up for the frustration that they had caused, he offered me and my colleague to have breakfast with him. We accepted the offer which never materialized. This guy never came back nor sent any message. When I was shouting at the Reception for opening the room, a lady was shouting about stinking bedsheets that were not changed. I can now understand why this hotel does not get good ratings despite being located next to Financial Center Metro Station and walking distance to DIFC. The hotel has only two restaurants. Food quality during lunch buffet was good and service in the restaurant was satisfactory. It looks like the building was originally built to be an apartment building and was later converted into hotel. Lobby is very small. The room given to me was a studio apartment. The bedroom was too small. There was barely any space to walk besides the bed. Bathroom was separate and had big ugly (refillable) bottles of shampoo, soap and lotion. Wi-fi is for a fee, even in the lobby. You don't expect all this from $250 / night hotel. This hotel has no bar and does not serve alcoholic drinks. Overall, I do not recommend this hotel unless you get it free.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious apartments near Dubai Mall”
Reviews.Author: Fill Blazer
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 bedroom apartment for a week in October. Very spacious with two king size beds, two bathrooms, a large kitchen including fridge, washing machine, microwave and a reasonable selection of plates and utensils. Rooftop pool was small but kept the kids amused for a while. The location is 2 mins walk from the metro, and a short taxi ride from Dubai mall. There are restaurants within walking distance but it is mainly offices nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service Irritating elevators”
Reviews.Author: spiritofscouse
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights at the Emirates Grand. The room was spacious and nice but here are a few thigs which I did not like. Twice i returned from business meetigns around 5pm and room was not yet ready. Minibar was empty The elevators are slow and make sound on arrival that you can hear all night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Mohi_Khater
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights at the Deluxe Room on May 2010. I was satisfied with the room amenities with big kitchen area. The room is spacious. The location is very convenient for business travelers. Also it is close to the Metro Station. I tried the breakfast only at the main restaurant and it was magnificent. The spa is also a remark. The rates are very competitive and good value for money. The hotel stuff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “we dont like it , we will never back to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: annalyen R
Reviews.Content: worst Hotel in the world, Elevator Slow , does not come only after waiting for a long time very bad management does not cooperate with Guests even if you ask for on of the Hotel manager . worst Hotel , Worst service ,Worst Managment

Reviews.Title: “Good value at a very good price”
Reviews.Author: globaltraveler05
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a delux room for 8 nights with my Wife and 5 month old baby. We felt the hotel was a perfect choice for us traveling with a baby as the room had a fully equipped kitchen and a washer and a dryer. We booked through a travel agent and got a very good rate with breakfast included which was also very good. The staff was vey nice and always wanted to play with our baby, the spa was also very good and affordable as they had a 15% off promotion for in-house guest. Chick in and out both were smooth, infect they gave us. Late check out at 5 with no extra charge. The location is very good if on a shopping trip as dubai mall is only 10 dh taxi ride away and the metro stauin is only a 2 min walk and it takes you to emirates mall, city centre mall, burj uman mall, and others, very easy to come from the airport in the metro also as difc station is 2 min walk from the mane door of the hotel. The only issue with the hotel we had were the elevators as they had only 4 and the hotel had over 350 rooms and apartment that were all full, the wait for the lift was 20 min at some times. All in all I would stay at this hotel on my next visit for sure if I get a room for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home would be a fair label for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AryanaToronto
Reviews.Content: While in transitition, I lived in this hotel for two months. I chose the hotel after carefully reviewing all other options close to DIFC and after trying few of them (reviews can be found) for short stays. No regrets. I would recommend the hotel without hesitation. I stayed in 1 bedroom suites all along ( do push for view, it's worth it) PROS: - clean, spacious, comfortable layout - comfortable bed - excellent food (breakfast buffet on the 46th or 47th floor), and excellent room service food from hotel restaurants - friendly and attentive staff. If there is any problem in the room, let them know and consider it fixed. - Equipped kitchen, and washing machine - Beautiful and complete gym on high floor, towels, music, even attending personal trainer CONS: - elevators..they can take forever and due to high traffic in this hotel you have to budget time to get to the lobby or to your room - internet can be slow not to the point of annoyance but not the fastest at times My last point is not a pro nor a con, it's an observation worth mentioning. This hotel hosts many families and usually many kids. As joyful as kids are, if you are trully looking for peace and quiet you might not always get that with kids occasionally running from room to room in the hall...again not frequent at all but during my long stay there were occasions when a large family occupied few rooms in the same floor and the consequences were unavoidable...but all good :)

Reviews.Title: “The Best Journey Ever”
Reviews.Author: paulnmaria86
Reviews.Content: The location was fantastic, breakfast was divine and the service from all the staff was exception, first class overall. It has to be one of the most enjoyable hotel’s I’ve ever stayed in. I have just arrived back from 3 nights at the Iberotel Emirates Grand Hotel Dubai. Our stay was amazing and I cannot fault anything about this hotel, it goes without saying that it’s one of the best hotel’s in the world from the décor to the service, Our room was big enough. The bed, well, you’ll just have to try it for yourself. You’ll feel like a king as you wake in the morning to your breakfast in the 43rd floor views over Dubai or if you’re lucky, over Burj Khalifah. The bedroom was nice, fluffy and warm. The staffs are efficient and charming. The food is great, and there is nothing like sitting out on the roof top on a beautiful afternoon enjoying the Shish and the crowd. Thank you for the excellent front office staff and their service. You have to do this in a lifetime, thank you,

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: malinq8
Reviews.Content: Staying here right now and am already looking forward to the next time. It was a little hard to find it since we were looking for the Angsana but lucky us, we stopped at our hotel to ask to directions and found it....lol! The service has been fast and with a smile. Don't mess with the little door lady. If she wants to take your bag, let her:) We had booked a suite but Garielle decided to treat us and upgrade us up to a 1 bedroom apartment since it was our first time here. How sweet! They are very quick in getting what you need too. We had come in from a long day and forgot to get toothpaste and asked if they had any at the reception. By the time we got up to our room, the guy was there waiting to give it to us. The most important part for me is that it is very cozy here. Yeah, the surrounding area isn't as pretty but I'm not sleeping outside. A starbucks, P&Q and a lebanese restaurant are a quick 3 minute walk to your right. A mini mart is in the back of there too. Haven't tried the breakfast and don't know if I will just because I'm not a big eater in the morning. If you like swimming, the pool is on the roof. It's a bit small for my taste, but I'm not swimming anyways. Location is great as its central and its not that hard to get a taxi like someone suggested...trust me...they are all over...you'll get one. You do have to pay for internet but with the price that Im paying of $80 a night, I didn't mind paying an extra 20 a day. The beds are super comfy and I slept really good. Love how the bathroom soap and lotions are in little dispensers. The ambience of the hotel reminds me of walking into a spa....very relaxing....especially as you go to your room......loved it here!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: aikman1
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as it is beside a metro station and is only across the road from Etihad's check-in office and bus transfer to Abu Dhabi. I stayed in a studio room which was a lot bigger than I expected. It was clean, modern and I thought it was great value for money. I would not hesitate staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: NaheedLancashire
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on business for two months, chose it mainly for its location on SZ road. The rooms are comfortable, little frayed around the edges, the housekeeping is non existent! The staff on reception are not the best and seem incapable of dealing with the most simple query. The internet costs are very steep. I have to go back to Dubai for another two months and i will not be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mindless drones ruin an otherwise good hotel”
Reviews.Author: fluffybinks
Reviews.Content: I just spent 6 nights in this hotel. What I liked: -good size rooms with kitchen and a washing machine - really great! -amazingly comfortable pillows -aircon that you could adjust yourself -good assortment of breakfast items - i loved the pancakes especially. - taxis always out the front - door man/woman always friendly and helpful - waiters at breakfast always friendly and helpful What I didn't like: 1. Food - No restaurant food until 7.00 pm - this is a problem if youve travelled from Australia, and are very tired and hungry and want to go to bed early! - thus, ordered room service on th1st night - the food was unimaginable abominations of burgers and club sandwiches - what is a dried up "ficken" pattie? yuk! barely ate and so the fact that there was - - no minibar of any sort, not even a soft drink or packet of chips made it hard... 2. Cleaner does not clean properly - the left over food (from 1 above) was put on the kitchen bench in a neat pile, it was obviously rubbish and plates for taking away - the cleaner left it there all day and would not take it away. I put the rubbish in the bin that night and left the room service dishes - they were still there the next day! 2 days! - no cups, spoons, glasses etc. were ever replaced. - had to keep asking for a cake of soap as items in the bathroom were never replenished except for towels. - i dont think the room was ever vacuumed in 6 days. - thus the cleaner - did not much cleaning! 3. - expensive internet charges. 4. You cannot walk anywhere from here, you need a taxi or a train. Its a very boring area. 5. Ugly rooftop pool. Dont be deceived by the photos on the website, the pool is ugly on an ugly rooftop- you would have to be desperate to swim here - and it opens late at 8.00 am - this is crazy if you want to do a few laps before your meetings etc. 6. Reception Desk Staff - reception desk staff are mindless drones! They cannot answer a simple question, they have no opinions, they do not know how to say anything except the "do you want fries with that" kind of response. One example, there were of us travelling, one was to leave a day early but she was using the work credit card to pay for all 3 rooms - we "thought" we arranged to do this as I spent 15 min at the reception desk the day before I left with her to arrange it. At the time of my checkout the next day, I was asked to pay - I said why when it had been taken care of, I was told not it hadnt i said but I spent 15 min with you yesterday arranging this - she said the credit card holder needed to sign, I said but she is in Paris which is why we did it yesterday - she kept saying - the same thing again and again - it would not register in her small brain- lets say i gave her an earfull but I had to pay - I hope we have not paid twice - I dont know yet! She and that desk of drones really ruined the hotel as my review would not have been so bad.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: groovysho
Reviews.Content: Iberotel Grand Emirates Hotel is very nice, the rooms are great, our room had a kitchen, washing machine, microwave, stove, cutlery, plates & fridge which was all very handy. The lifts however are very very slow. The concierge is very good if you need him to arrange high tea at the Burj al Arab. The inclusive breakfast is also very good, although they only open at 7am, which is the only downside. The hotel is also almost next door to the Metro (trains), very handy.

Reviews.Title: “5 star indeed..!”
Reviews.Author: bonnnsai
Reviews.Content: I 've stayed in a fair number of 5 start hotels over the past 40 years. This one lacks finesse and class in my opinion. On the whole it may pass as a 5*, the lobby, facade may look nice, but the touches that really make it a 5*, however small they may be, are missing. Small bedrooms, poorly designed bath room (have to reach out for the toliet paper), service( fridge was empty , tea and coffee miserly stocked , attitude of front desk staff ) etc. Finally on checking out, they asked us where the hairdryer was..!!! :-) ...and we didn't even use the thing..!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location but staff was not organised”
Reviews.Author: MCB110611
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 24. - 31. December 2010. The location of the hotel is great. Just round the corner was the metro station. Taxis were always in front of the hotel. Rooms very big, always clean. Our room was located in the 27th floor. The view was amzing. The first three days were perfect. Everything was great. The troubles started at day 4. Due to the New Years Eve Events in Dubai more people stayed at our hotel. So the staff had a lot of people to serve and they were obviously not used to it. We waited almost 10 Minutes at our not finished breakfast table for clean cutlery to start with our breakfast. After breakfast we tried to get either back to our room or to the lobby. Unfortunately the elevators did not work correct. First we had to wait a long time to even be on it and then it took forever to reach the floor we wanted, because the elevator stopped at every floor (even though there was no one there to get on it). At the end we were very happy to leave this hotel. If those problems occured at the first day, we would have checked out earlier.

Reviews.Title: “JUST PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: dkotova
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 5 days ( 29.12-03.01). the hotel is great. the location is great. Dubai mall and Burj Khalifa are just one stop away by the underground or 15 min walking. The apartments are very well equiped - absolutely everything you can imagine, even cutlery and stuff for cooking. The apartments are very clean and the service was excellent with very friendly and helpful staff - thay helped us to book a special dinner at Burj Al Arab hotel.. The pool is small and the sun comes after 3 p.m :). We loved the hotel. We had wonderful time and new year celebration. I work as a travel agent for 3 years, I have been to many hotels around the world and I can truly say Emirates Grand hotel is real 4+* at least ..... I can recomend it wihout hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect !!!”
Reviews.Author: VeraSvarcova
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very very good in all aspects - perfect location, very nice rooms, very nice service people, very good breakfast ... Only one big and not understandable mistake - very expensive internet !!!! Why it costs 45 AED per hour when in other hotels of this category is free and in every internet cafee on the street is for AED 5 per hour ???? I needed it for 5 minutes only but had to pay AED 45 !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff, convenient location and good value”
Reviews.Author: SyedRuislip
Reviews.Content: My wife, eight year old son and I stayed one week in the Deluxe room. The accommodation included a very comfortable master bed and a sofa bed that just about can be used by an eight year old, but not ideal. The kitchenette comes well equipped and was spotlessly clean. The staff were friendly and helpful without being over-bearing or overtly looking for tips. The rooftop pool admittedly is small, however, during our stay we were more often than not the only ones using the pool - surprising given that our stay was during UK half term. There were quite a few guests using the rooftop mainly for sunbathing. Though mentioned in their website, I did not notice a drinks area by the pool. A huge plus for the hotel is the location. It is almost adjacent to Dubai Metro marker 24 'Financial Centre'. This makes it very easy and economical to move around Dubai including the major Shopping Malls, (Dubai, Emirates, Deira City centre etc. ) using this metro service. The Dubai metro is fully automated, frequent, clean, air conditioned and cheap - make sure you buy a card. Not sure if this common with other hotels in the area or hotels in general - we would have liked to have used the internet through our laptop now and then, but decided against it given it would have cost nearly nearly £18 a day for the privilege. Overall we really enjoyed our stay a the hotel and would be comfortable in recommending others to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “clean but average service”
Reviews.Author: laloool
Reviews.Content: nice hotel and new building and excellent location in the street Zayed

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a buisness trip or stopover.”
Reviews.Author: mrmattb
Reviews.Content: The service on arrival was excellent. The friendly staff made check-in a breeze with cold towels and complimentary drinks on arrival. The hotel wasn't quite finished when I arrived - the main entrance/lobby was still under construction but the rest of the hotel was excellent. I had one of the studio rooms and it was very spacious, modern, clean & comfortable. I only used the room service for food but that too was very good. The only downside was the location, it's far away from the beach area, and it's difficult to walk anywhere - although this is a problem for most of Dubai - pavements just disappear! Having said that, taxis are fairly cheap & the new metro system has a station right by the hotel & this will take you straight into the airport terminal or to the malls etc. Having spent 2 nights here I’d happily recommend this hotel (despite being a Hilton fan!).

HotelInfo.Name: Iberotel Emirates Grand Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Sheikh Zayed Road, Near Finance Centre | Metro Stop, Dubai 116957, United Arab Emirates
